meanings.definition: Make (a disease or its symptoms) less severe or unpleasant without removing the cause.
meanings.sent1: She tried to palliate her headache by taking a pain reliever.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often use medication to palliate the pain of their patients.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to palliate the awkward silence with a joke.
meanings.sent4: His smile could palliate even the darkest of moods.
meanings.sent5: The soothing music seemed to palliate the stress in the room.

meanings.definition: Cover up a fault or offense.
meanings.sent1: He tried to palliate his mistake by offering an apology.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes try to palliate their scandals with excuses.
meanings.sent3: The student attempted to palliate his failing grade by blaming the teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her charm could palliate any criticism thrown her way.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful artwork seemed to palliate the flaws in the room.
